September 27, 1961
Mr. Loren B. Stone
KCTS ,TV
University of Washington
Seattle 5, Washington
L^
Dear Loren:
I have received no invitation from Jack or Jftn to attend the NETRC
affiliate's meeting in New York, and, although I'm sure this can be
arranged, I feel that I can't take the time to attend in any case.
I have grudgingly agreed to go the last three days of the Purdue In¬
ternational Seminar. This means that I will not be able to get back
to Washington until the 19th and I definitely need the Thursday, Fri¬
day and Saturday before the Board Meeting and the Convention to wind
up a thousand and one things in preparation for these events. So, much
as I would like to be there to participate, I believe it a more prudent
course not to try and crowd the Affiliates meeting in on top of every¬
thing else and 1 will leave the NAEB representation up to you and Hull.
I know of no particular problems that require a meeting of the TV
Board. If the new TV Exchange Committee was ready with a recommen¬
dation, this might have motivated such a meeting. It will probably
have a report and a recommendation ready for the Columbus Board Me¬
eting in May.
You'll be pleased to note that we have secured Ken Cox to serve as
the FCC expert in the Convention panel dealing with the FCC problems.
Cordially yours,
WGH/mmm
William G. Harley
